intro: Jacquemontia bifida, commonly known as the splitleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are deeply divided, giving it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and open in the morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks. Jacquemontia bifida is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other climbing and trailing plants.
